alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 26 at 7:47PM MDT until June 27 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE WITH DRY THUNDERSTORMS... .Strengthening southwest flow across northwestern New Mexico in advance of a slow-moving Pacific low will combine with an extremely dry and unstable atmosphere Tuesday to produce critical to locally extreme fire weather conditions. Dry thunderstorms over parts of the area will be capable of strong and erratic downburst winds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...North Central Mountains (Zone 120) Tuesday afternoon and early evening. Scattered dry thunderstorms are also expected. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...15 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
